intro: Acer longipes var. nanchuanense, commonly known as the Nanchuan winged maple, is a rare deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive winged seeds and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with high altitude and humid climate. Its bark is smooth and light gray, while its foliage turns vibrant yellow in autumn. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
